Time management: Balancing writing, research, and other responsibilities can be challenging, leading to procrastination and difficulty in meeting deadlines.
Lack of motivation: The author may lose motivation to continue writing, leading to a decrease in productivity and potential abandonment of the project.
Distractions: The author may face distractions from their surroundings, such as noise or interruptions from family or friends, making it difficult to focus and complete the book.
Self-doubt: The author may experience self-doubt about their writing abilities, leading to hesitation and a lack of confidence in their work.
Perfectionism: The author may struggle with the desire to make their book perfect, leading to excessive revisions and a delay in completing the project.
